2.verse: She weeps bitterly in the night.

3.verse: Judah has gone into captivity because of affliction,

5.verse: Her adversaries have become the head.

6.verse: All majesty has departed from the daughter of Zion.

7.verse: Jerusalem remembers in the days of her affliction and of her miseries

9.verse: Her filthiness was in her skirts.

10.verse: The adversary has spread out his hand on all her pleasant things;

12.verse: “Is it nothing to you, all you who pass by?

13.verse: “From on high has he sent fire into my bones,

14.verse: “The yoke of my transgressions is bound by his hand.

15.verse: “The Lord has set at nothing all my mighty men within me.

20.verse: “Look, Yahweh; for I am in distress.

22.verse: “Let all their wickedness come before you.

1.verse: How has the Lord covered the daughter of Zion with a cloud in his anger!

2.verse: The Lord has swallowed up all the dwellings of Jacob

3.verse: He has cut off all the horn of Israel in fierce anger.

4.verse: He has bent his bow like an enemy.

5.verse: The Lord has become as an enemy.

6.verse: He has violently taken away his tabernacle,

7.verse: The Lord has cast off his altar.

8.verse: Yahweh has purposed to destroy the wall of the daughter of Zion.

9.verse: Her gates have sunk into the ground.

10.verse: The elders of the daughter of Zion sit on the ground.

13.verse: What shall I testify to you?

14.verse: Your prophets have seen false and foolish visions for you.

15.verse: All that pass by clap their hands at you.

16.verse: All your enemies have opened their mouth wide against you.

17.verse: Yahweh has done that which he planned.

18.verse: Their heart cried to the Lord.

19.verse: Arise, cry out in the night,

20.verse: “Look, Yahweh, and see to whom you have done thus!

21.verse: “The youth and the old man lie on the ground in the streets.

22.verse: “You have called, as in the day of a solemn assembly, my terrors on every side.

1.verse: I am the man who has seen affliction

2.verse: He has led me and caused me to walk in darkness,

3.verse: Surely he turns his hand against me

4.verse: He has made my flesh and my skin old.

6.verse: He has made me dwell in dark places,

7.verse: He has walled me about, so that I can’t go out.

8.verse: Yes, when I cry, and call for help,

9.verse: He has walled up my ways with cut stone.

10.verse: He is to me as a bear lying in wait,

11.verse: He has turned away my ways,

13.verse: He has caused the shafts of his quiver to enter into my kidneys.

14.verse: I have become a derision to all my people,

15.verse: He has filled me with bitterness.

16.verse: He has also broken my teeth with gravel.

17.verse: You have removed my soul far away from peace.

19.verse: Remember my affliction and my misery,

21.verse: This I recall to my mind;

22.verse: It is because of Yahweh’s loving kindnesses that we are not consumed,

24.verse: “Yahweh is my portion,” says my soul.

25.verse: Yahweh is good to those who wait for him,

26.verse: It is good that a man should hope

27.verse: It is good for a man that he bear the yoke in his youth.

28.verse: Let him sit alone and keep silence,

29.verse: Let him put his mouth in the dust,

30.verse: Let him give his cheek to him who strikes him.

31.verse: For the Lord will not cast off forever.

33.verse: For he does not afflict willingly,

34.verse: To crush under foot all the prisoners of the earth,

35.verse: to turn away the right of a man before the face of the Most High,

36.verse: to subvert a man in his cause, the Lord doesn’t approve.

37.verse: Who is he who says, and it comes to pass,

38.verse: Doesn’t evil and good come out of the mouth of the Most High?

39.verse: Why does a living man complain,

40.verse: Let us search and try our ways,

41.verse: Let’s lift up our heart with our hands to God in the heavens.

43.verse: “You have covered us with anger and pursued us.

44.verse: You have covered yourself with a cloud,

45.verse: You have made us an off-scouring and refuse

46.verse: “All our enemies have opened their mouth wide against us.

47.verse: Terror and the pit have come on us,

48.verse: My eye runs down with streams of water,

52.verse: They have chased me relentlessly like a bird,

53.verse: They have cut off my life in the dungeon,

55.verse: I called on your name, Yahweh,

57.verse: You came near in the day that I called on you.

58.verse: Lord, you have pleaded the causes of my soul.

59.verse: Yahweh, you have seen my wrong.

60.verse: You have seen all their vengeance

61.verse: You have heard their reproach, Yahweh,

62.verse: the lips of those that rose up against me,

63.verse: You see their sitting down and their rising up.

64.verse: You will pay them back, Yahweh,

65.verse: You will give them hardness of heart,

66.verse: You will pursue them in anger,

1.verse: How the gold has become dim!

3.verse: Even the jackals offer their breast.

4.verse: The tongue of the nursing child clings to the roof of his mouth for thirst.

5.verse: Those who ate delicacies are desolate in the streets.

6.verse: For the iniquity of the daughter of my people is greater than the sin of Sodom,

7.verse: Her nobles were purer than snow.

8.verse: Their appearance is blacker than a coal.

9.verse: Those who are killed with the sword are better than those who are killed with hunger;

10.verse: The hands of the pitiful women have boiled their own children.

12.verse: The kings of the earth didn’t believe,

13.verse: It is because of the sins of her prophets

14.verse: They wander as blind men in the streets.

19.verse: Our pursuers were swifter than the eagles of the sky.

21.verse: Rejoice and be glad, daughter of Edom,

22.verse: The punishment of your iniquity is accomplished, daughter of Zion.

1.verse: Remember, Yahweh, what has come on us.

2.verse: Our inheritance has been turned over to strangers,

4.verse: We have drunken our water for money.

5.verse: Our pursuers are on our necks.

6.verse: We have given our hands to the Egyptians,

7.verse: Our fathers sinned, and are no more.

9.verse: We get our bread at the peril of our lives,

10.verse: Our skin is black like an oven,

11.verse: They ravished the women in Zion,

12.verse: Princes were hanged up by their hands.

14.verse: The elders have ceased from the gate,

15.verse: The joy of our heart has ceased.

16.verse: The crown has fallen from our head.

17.verse: For this our heart is faint.

18.verse: for the mountain of Zion, which is desolate.

20.verse: Why do you forget us forever,

21.verse: Turn us to yourself, Yahweh, and we will be turned.

22.verse: But you have utterly rejected us.
